author: Laurent Fintoni, Francesca Tomasi, Marilena Daquino

description.en: The PCDAI Data Model Ontology connects complementary ontological entities from existing standards to provide descriptive metadata for use within the PCDAI pilot project (link TBC). The Data Model is divided into three segments, each attached to an existing standard within the ontology: public data (DCAT, including EU and IT Application Profiles); academic provenance (PROV-O), and cultural heritage information (CIDOC CRM and extensions). Together these segments allow to describe various aspects of academic research projects and their outputs within the context of the PCDAI pilot including: - Research project activity: who created what, how, where, and when. - This can be modeled as provenance using PROV-O elements centered on the prov:Activity class and/or as a form of cultural heritage activity using CIDOC CRM elements centered on the D7 Digital Machine Event class (from the CRMdig extension) - Further specificity as to what kinds of sub-activities took place within the research project can be expressed using subclasses of D7, such as for example digitization processes (D2 Digitization Process) or the use of software on digital objects (D10 Software Execution). - Research project outputs, the digital objects created by research project activities, can be represented regardless of their form as public datasets (DCAT), digital objects (CRMdig), or entities used in activities (PROV-O). - The ontology is intended to be flexible enough to enable the description of various possible outputs such as software, websites, documentation, web services, and data collections. - In addition to being conceptualized as activity, research projects are also conceptualized as a type of output within the DCAT segment of the model in order to act as a container for other research outputs. This conceptualization is intended to represent research projects websites, where outputs and documentation are often collected together in one place. - The agents responsible for creating and publishing research projects and outputs, from the individual to the organization via organizational units (such as departments or laboratories) and their locations. - Relationships between different research projects and their outputs, within an existing organization or across different organizations. - This includes concepts such as influence and inspiration as well as the reuse of outputs to create new projects and/or outputs. - The spatial and temporal information recorded in research project outputs, such as for example the places mentioned in a text or the time period covered by the data. - Themes such as the type of research activity, the type of outputs, the technologies used, the academic disciplines involved, and the primary and secondary subjects of research. These themes are described using a selection of specific controlled vocabularies and authorities. <https://laurentfintoni.com/pcdai/data_model_core.jpg>

publisher.value: Dipartimento di Filologia Classica e Italianistica - FICLIT

abstract.value: The PCDAI Data Model Ontology brings together existing and complementary ontological entities from three primary standards for the purpose of describing academic research projects and their outputs as examples of the digital cultural heritage of Italian universities. The resulting descriptive metadata is used in the PCDAI pilot project to catalogue academic research and integrate it into the national Digital Library initiative led by the Istituto Centrale per la Digitalizzazione del Patrimonio Culturale within the Ministero della Cultura. Both the ontology and the data model are freely available for universities, and other interested parties, to use to model their own data for independent use or to allow its inclusion within the pilot project.

definition.value: This general class comprises discrete, identifiable, instances of E77 Persistent Item that are documented as single units, that either consist of matter or depend on being carried by matter and are characterized by relative stability. They may be intellectual products or physical things. They may for instance have a solid physical form, an electronic encoding, or they may be a logical concept or structure.

scopeNote.value: This class is included as the superclass for D1 Digital Object and range for P106 property.

comment.en: This general class comprises discrete, identifiable, instances of E77 Persistent Item that are documented as single units, that either consist of matter or depend on being carried by matter and are characterized by relative stability. They may be intellectual products or physical things. They may for instance have a solid physical form, an electronic encoding, or they may be a logical concept or structure. Usage Note: This class is included as the superclass for D1 Digital Object and range for P106 property.

definition.value: An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity.

scopeNote.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. In the case of people or entities involved in research projects, the PROV-O definition underlines the responsibility of an agent towards an activity or entity whereas the FOAF definition focuses on the aspect of doing and the CIDOC CRM definition focuses on the potential of actors to do things. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: An agent is something that bears some form of responsibility for an activity taking place, for the existence of an entity, or for another agent's activity. definition.value: An accessible form of a dataset such as a downloadable file (W3C DCAT documentation).

scopeNote.value: This class is intended to represent the downloadable forms that a dataset can take. While both the W3C and DCAT AP definitions could be interpreted as covering non-downloable forms (one can access a dataset via a web interface and never actually have access to the underlying data itself on a local machine), within the context of the PCDAI Data Model the distribution class explicitly refers only to downloadable forms. As with the data service class, we make close reference to the DCAT AP 2.1.1 usage guide note on distinctions between distribution and data service, which makes it clear that while datasets and data services are entities in their own right a distribution cannot exist without its dataset. It further states: "distributions are specific representations of a dataset, described with the intend to facilitate the delivery of the data as file to a reuser. The access URL (preferably download URL) will provide a simple way to obtain (download) the content of the dataset in the representation specified by the distribution. The obtained (downloaded) content is fully determined by the publisher of the distribution. Only after obtaining the data the (re)user can change the data according to its needs. ".

comment.en: An accessible form of a dataset such as a downloadable file (W3C DCAT documentation). Usage Note: This class is intended to represent the downloadable forms that a dataset can take. As with the data service class, we make close reference to the DCAT AP 2.1.1 usage guide note on distinctions between distribution and data service, which makes it clear that while datasets and data services are entities in their own right a distribution cannot exist without its dataset. definition.value: An Organization such as a department or support unit which is part of some larger Organization and only has full recognition within the context of that Organization. In particular the unit would not be regarded as a legal entity in its own right.

scopeNote.value: This class should be used to represent entities such as departments or laboratories which are often responsible for creating research projects and their outputs.

definition.value: A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as by a coordinate, address, landmark, and so forth.

scopeNote.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. In the case of places related to a research project, the data model also makes use of dct:Location and crm:E53_Place, which refer specifically to geographical places. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

definition.value: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity.

scopeNote.value: This class should be used when needed for additional description of the potential relationships between research project outputs where an output is a derivation of a physical object (digitization) or of a digital object, including another research project's output.

comment.en: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity. Usage Note: This class should be used when needed for additional description of the potential relationships between research project outputs where an output is a derivation of a physical object (digitization) or of a digital object, including another research project's output.

definition.value: This class comprises products rendering one or more Expressions. A Manifestation is defined by both the overall content and the form of its presentation. The substance of F3 Manifestation is not only signs, but also the manner in which they are presented to be consumed by users, including the kind of media adopted.

scopeNote.value: This class is defined based on the LRMoo v0.9 documentation. It is included to represent the manifestations that are materialized in instances of F5 Item and which can be about an E1 CRM Entity, and which are tied to digitization processes and digital machine events such as for example the transformation of a text into a linguistic corpus.

definition.value: This class comprises physical objects (printed books, scores, CDs, DVDs, CD-ROMS, etc.) that were produced by (P186i) an industrial process involving a given instance of F3 Manifestation. As a result, all the instances of F5 Item associated with a given instance of F3 Manifestation are expected to carry the content defined in that instance of F3 Manifestation, although some or even all of them may happen to carry a content that significantly differs from it, due to either an accident in the course of industrial production, or subsequent physical modification or degradation.

scopeNote.value: This class is defined from the LRMoo v0.9 documentation. It is included to represent the items that materialize instances of F3 Manifestation, and which are tied to digitization processes and digital machine events such as for example the transformation of a text into a linguistic corpus.

definition.value: A rate at which something recurs.

scopeNote.value: This class is included as the range for the accrual periodicity property.

comment.en: A rate at which something recurs.

definition.value: This class comprises events that happen on physical digital devices following a human activity that intentionally caused its immediate or delayed initiation and results in the creation of a new instance of D1 Digital Object on behalf of the human actor. The input of a D7 Digital Machine Event may be parameter settings and/or data to be processed. Some D7 Digital Machine Events may form part of a wider E65 Creation event. In this case, all machine output of the partial events is regarded as creation of the overall activity.

scopeNote.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. This class should be used to represent a research project as an example of activity within the cultural heritage segment of the data model. As such this class indicates the cultural heritage dimension of the research project activity, by focusing on how research projects make use of existing cultural heritage entities to produce new digital objects. By contrast, the research project activity under the PROV-O model does not have this cultural heritage association and is meant to represent its academic provenance.

definition.value: Represents a collection of people organized together into a community or other social, commercial or political structure. The group has some common purpose or reason for existence which goes beyond the set of people belonging to it and can act as an Agent. Organizations are often decomposable into hierarchical structures.

note.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. In the case of activity, the data model conceptualizes research projects as examples of activities using E7_Activity (in the cultural heritage context) and prov:Activity (in the provenance context), which conceptualizes activity as related to time as well as acting upon entities. The DCAT model includes a clear connection between the dataset class and the activity class via the prov:wasGeneratedBy property which is a starting point for the PCDAI Data Model's dual conceptualization of research projects as both activity and datasets that contain other datasets (dcat:Catalog). In this sense, a research project is an activity that generates a container that holds all of the output of the activity. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

definition.value: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

definition.value: An entity is a physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary.

scopeNote.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. In the academic provenance segment of the data model, an entity is primarily intended to represent research outputs (which can also be conceptualized as instances of crmdig:D1_Digital_Object and dcat:Dataset in the other segments of the data model) or things that have a relationship to the research project such as objects that are digitized or primary subjects of research. For example, a dataset produced by a research project would be an instance of dcat:Dataset, crmdig:D1_Digital_Object (produced by a D7 class activity) and prov:Entity (generated by a prov:Activity) while a historical figure that is the subject of the research may be an instance of prov:Entity and crm:E1_Entity.

comment.en: An entity is a physical, digital, conceptual, or other kind of thing with some fixed aspects; entities may be real or imaginary. Usage Note: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. definition.value: A statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights.

scopeNote.value: This class is primarily intended to cover rights outside the scope of the Licenze controlled vocabulary, such as copyright statements.

comment.en: A statement about the intellectual property rights (IPR) held in or over a resource, a legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource, or a statement about access rights. Usage Note: This class is primarily intended to cover rights outside the scope of the Licenze controlled vocabulary, such as copyright statements.

definition.value: Influence is the capacity of an entity, activity, or agent to have an effect on the character, development, or behavior of another by means of usage, start, end, generation, invalidation, communication, derivation, attribution, association, or delegation.

scopeNote.value: This class should be used for additional description of the potential relationships between research project, agents, and outputs and other instances of agent, activity, or entity that have an effect on them. In the context of the PCDAI Data Model influence is taken in its traditional literal sense such as a historical figure or moment (entity) having an influence on the research project (activity) because it is its primary subject.

comment.en: Influence is the capacity of an entity, activity, or agent to have an effect on the character, development, or behavior of another by means of usage, start, end, generation, invalidation, communication, derivation, attribution, association, or delegation. Usage Note: This class should be used for additional description of the potential relationships between research project, agents, and outputs and other instances of agent, activity, or entity that have an effect on them. In the context of the PCDAI Data Model influence is taken in its traditional literal sense such as a historical figure or moment (entity) having an influence on the research project (activity) because it is its primary subject.

definition.value: A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: This class is intended to represent research projects as containers (rather than activities) for outputs, which are themselves conceptualized using the DCAT dataset and data service classes. The most common example of such containers would be websites where the project and its outputs are documented, shared, and, sometimes, made available for interaction. While the PCDAI Data Model refers to the DCAT AP definition, the W3C definition of the catalogue class, as "a curated collection of metadata about resources (e.g., datasets and data services in the context of a data catalog)", is also useful as is the usage note that web-base data catalogs are typically represented as a single instance of the class. Furthermore, the W3C version of DCAT explicitly makes dcat:Catalog a subclass of dcat:Dataset, allowing to conceptualize the research project as container as another form of output from the research project as activity. See the PCDAI Data Model documentation on our website for practical examples.

comment.en: A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: This class is intended to represent research projects as containers (rather than activities) for outputs, which are themselves conceptualized using the DCAT dataset and data service classes. The most common example of such containers would be websites where the project and its outputs are documented, shared, and, sometimes, made available for interaction. While the PCDAI Data Model refers to the DCAT AP definition, the W3C definition of the catalogue class, as "a curated collection of metadata about resources (e.g., datasets and data services in the context of a data catalog)", is also useful as is the usage note that web-base data catalogs are typically represented as a single instance of the class. Furthermore, the W3C version of DCAT explicitly makes dcat:Catalog a subclass of dcat:Dataset, allowing to conceptualize the research project as container as another form of output from the research project as activity. See the PCDAI Data Model documentation on our website for practical examples.

definition.value: This class comprises instances of D1 Digital Object that are the direct result of a digital measurement or a formal derivative of it, containing quantitative properties of some physical things or other constellations of matter.

scopeNote.value: This class should be used to represent the outputs of D2 Digitization Process and which, as noted in the scope note for the D2 class, may represent the outputs of a research project activity.

comment.en: This class comprises instances of D1 Digital Object that are the direct result of a digital measurement or a formal derivative of it, containing quantitative properties of some physical things or other constellations of matter. Usage Note: This class should be used to represent the outputs of D2 Digitization Process and which, as noted in the scope note for the D2 class, may represent the outputs of a research project activity.

definition.value: This class comprises software codes,computer programs,procedures, and functions that are used to operate a system of digital objects.

scopeNote.value: This class should be used to represent conceptual versions of software: software as an example of the output of a research project; and software used in a research project activity (instance of D7_Digital_Machine_Event) and further qualified by using the PCDAI Technology Thesaurus.

comment.en: This class comprises software codes,computer programs,procedures, and functions that are used to operate a system of digital objects. Usage Note: This class should be used to represent conceptual versions of software: software as an example of the output of a research project; and software used in a research project activity (instance of D7_Digital_Machine_Event) and further qualified by using the PCDAI Technology Thesaurus.

definition.value: This class comprises events by which a digital device runs a software program or a series of computing operations on a digital object as a single task, which is completely determined by its digital input, the software and the generic properties of the device.

scopeNote.value: This class is intended as the primary representation of a sub-activity within a research project that involves using software or computational operations on a digital object, such as for example creating data visualizations or statistical operations on a text corpus. The specific details of the software execution are outside the scope of the PCDAI Data Model.

comment.en: This class comprises events by which a digital device runs a software program or a series of computing operations on a digital object as a single task, which is completely determined by its digital input, the software and the generic properties of the device. Usage Note: This class is intended as the primary representation of a sub-activity within a research project that involves using software or computational operations on a digital object, such as for example creating data visualizations or statistical operations on a text corpus. The specific details of the software execution are outside the scope of the PCDAI Data Model.

definition.value: This class comprises extents in the natural space we live in, in particular on the surface of the Earth, in the pure sense of physics: independent from temporal phenomena and matter.

scopeNote.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. In the case of places related to a research project, the data model also makes use of dct:Location, which bears close conceptual resemblance to E53_Place in a simplified way, and prov:Location, which conceptualizes location as both geographical and non-geographical. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: This class comprises extents in the natural space we live in, in particular on the surface of the Earth, in the pure sense of physics: independent from temporal phenomena and matter. Usage Note: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues.

definition.value: This class comprises all things in the universe of discourse of the CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model.

scopeNote.value: This class is included to allow for flexibility when describing entities related to instances of F3 Manifestation and D2 Digitization Process via the appropriate properties.

comment.en: This class comprises all things in the universe of discourse of the CIDOC Conceptual Reference Model. Usage Note: This class is included to allow for flexibility when describing entities related to instances of F3 Manifestation and D2 Digitization Process via the appropriate properties.

definition.value: A spatial region or named place.

scopeNote.value: Uses values from Geonames and Wikidata.

comment.en: A spatial region or named place. Usage Note: Uses values from Geonames and Wikidata.

definition.value: This class comprises events that result in the creation of instances of D9 Data Object that represent the appearance and/or form of an instance of E18 Physical Thing such as paper documents, statues, buildings, paintings, etc. A particular case is the analogue-to-digital conversion of audiovisual material. This class represents the transition from a material thing to an immaterial representation of it.

scopeNote.value: This class is intended as the primary representation of a sub-activity within a research project that involves digitizing physical objects to create digital copies. Such copies may then form part of the research project's output, whether or not they go through further processes. The details of the digitization process, such as whether or not a digital object is further changed before arriving at the final form included in an official output, while able to be described by the CRM DIG model are outside the scope of the PCDAI Data Model.

comment.en: This class comprises events that result in the creation of instances of D9 Data Object that represent the appearance and/or form of an instance of E18 Physical Thing such as paper documents, statues, buildings, paintings, etc. A particular case is the analogue-to-digital conversion of audiovisual material. This class represents the transition from a material thing to an immaterial representation of it. Usage Note: This class is intended as the primary representation of a sub-activity within a research project that involves digitizing physical objects to create digital copies. Such copies may then form part of the research project's output, whether or not they go through further processes. The details of the digitization process, such as whether or not a digital object is further changed before arriving at the final form included in an official output, while able to be described by the CRM DIG model are outside the scope of the PCDAI Data Model.

definition.value: A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: This class is intended to represent web services that give access to datasets and/or data processing functions. In many cases these web services may well be part of the same website that is also conceptualized as an individual of the dcat:Catalog class, therefore a research project's website may fulfill the conceptual function of both a container for the project's outputs by collecting the relevant (meta)data in one place and a web service that gives access to the underlying data(sets) and data processing functions to interact with the data(sets) such as search functionalities (to use one of the most common examples). The PCDAI Data Model also refers to the usage guide note about distinctions between data service and distribution included in the DCAT AP 2.1.1 release that makes the following points: "a data service is an entity in its own right" that "provides access to datasets or data processing functions"; a distribution is "not required to be the result of the data service operations"; "anything that has not the intend to provide a downloadable representation of a dataset is a data service, [they] offer smarter, more interactive ways to the data". See the PCDAI Data Model documentation on our website for practical examples.

comment.en: A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: This class is intended to represent web services that give access to datasets and/or data processing functions. In many cases these web services may well be part of the same website that is also conceptualized as an individual of the dcat:Catalog class, therefore a research project's website may fulfill the conceptual function of both a container for the project's outputs by collecting the relevant (meta)data in one place and a web service that gives access to the underlying data(sets) and data processing functions to interact with the data(sets) such as search functionalities (to use one of the most common examples). The PCDAI Data Model also refers to the usage guide note about distinctions between data service and distribution included in the DCAT AP 2.1.1 release that makes the following points: "a data service is an entity in its own right" that "provides access to datasets or data processing functions"; a distribution is "not required to be the result of the data service operations"; "anything that has not the intend to provide a downloadable representation of a dataset is a data service, [they] offer smarter, more interactive ways to the data". See the PCDAI Data Model documentation on our website for practical examples.

definition.value: A reference point against which other things can be evaluated or compared.

comment.en: A reference point against which other things can be evaluated or compared.

definition.value: A system of signs, symbols, sounds, gestures, or rules used in communication.

scopeNote.value: Uses values from the EU Language authority table (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: A system of signs, symbols, sounds, gestures, or rules used in communication. Usage Note: Uses values from the EU Language authority table (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: An identifier in a particular context, consisting of the content string that is the identifier; an optional identifier for the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the version of the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the agency that manages the identifier scheme.

comment.en: An identifier in a particular context, consisting of the content string that is the identifier; an optional identifier for the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the version of the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the agency that manages the identifier scheme.

definition.value: This class comprises identifiable immaterial items that can be represented as sets of bit sequences, such as data sets, e-texts, images, audio or video items, software, etc., and are documented as single units. Any aggregation of instances of D1 Digital Object into a whole treated as single unit is also regarded as an instance of D1 Digital Object.

scopeNote.value: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. This class should be used to represent outputs of research project activity, with a focus on their quality as examples of digital cultural heritage produced and maintained by Italian universities, within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Research project outputs may also be conceptualized as instances of prov:Entity and dcat:Dataset.

comment.en: This class comprises identifiable immaterial items that can be represented as sets of bit sequences, such as data sets, e-texts, images, audio or video items, software, etc., and are documented as single units. Any aggregation of instances of D1 Digital Object into a whole treated as single unit is also regarded as an instance of D1 Digital Object. Usage Note: The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. This class should be used to represent outputs of research project activity, with a focus on their quality as examples of digital cultural heritage produced and maintained by Italian universities, within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model.

definition.value: Represents those things which are, broadly conceived, 'documents'.

scopeNote.value: With regards to the usage note in the FOAF documentation that states it does not make a distinction between physical and electronic documents within this class, the PCDAI Data Model primarily uses this class for electronic documents.

comment.en: Represents those things which are, broadly conceived, 'documents'. Usage Note: With regards to the usage note in the FOAF documentation that states it does not make a distinction between physical and electronic documents within this class, the PCDAI Data Model primarily uses this class for electronic documents.

definition.value: This class comprises actions intentionally carried out by instances of E39 Actor that result in changes of state in the cultural, social, or physical systems documented.

scopeNote.value: This class is included as the superclass for D7 Digital Machine Event. The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues. In the case of activity, the data model conceptualizes research projects as examples of activities using E7 (in the cultural heritage context) and prov:Activity (in the provenance context), which conceptualizes activity as related to time as well as acting upon entities. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: This class comprises actions intentionally carried out by instances of E39 Actor that result in changes of state in the cultural, social, or physical systems documented. Usage Note: This class is included as the superclass for D7 Digital Machine Event. The PCDAI Data Model brings together three different 'segments' - public data, cultural heritage, provenance - each based around a standard that includes classes which refer to similar concepts but which are respectively defined with enough difference that individuals should be assigned each class (as appropriate) to avoid issues.

definition.value: A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations (W3C DCAT documentation).

scopeNote.value: This class is intended to represent digital outputs of research projects, whatever their 'form', and is conceptually related to prov:Entity and crmdig:D1_Digital_Object within the PCDAI Data Model's three segments. As such an annotated textual corpus, a piece of software written in Java, and a relational database storing information about physical items can all be conceptualized as a dataset, with the research project that led to their creation conceptualized within the DCAT segment of the PCDAI Data Model as the catalogue that holds their (meta)data and the website that makes it possible to interact with them conceptualized as the data service (the research project as activity is conceptualized with classes from PROV-O and CIDOC CRM). See the PCDAI Data Model documentation on our website for practical examples.

comment.en: A collection of data, published or curated by a single agent, and available for access or download in one or more representations (W3C DCAT documentation). Usage Note: This class is intended to represent digital outputs of research projects, whatever their 'form'. As such an annotated textual corpus, a piece of software written in Java, and a relational database storing information about physical items can all be conceptualized as a dataset, with the research project that led to their creation conceptualized within the DCAT segment of the PCDAI Data Model as the catalogue that holds their (meta)data and the website that makes it possible to interact with them conceptualized as the data service (the research project as activity is conceptualized with classes from PROV-O and CIDOC CRM). See the PCDAI Data Model documentation on our website for practical examples.

definition.value: This class comprises all persistent physical items with a relatively stable form, human-made or natural.

scopeNote.value: Should be used for objects used in the digitization process and acts as the superclass for the F5 Item class in LRMoo/FRBRoo.

comment.en: This class comprises all persistent physical items with a relatively stable form, human-made or natural. Usage Note: Should be used for objects used in the digitization process and acts as the superclass for the F5 Item class in LRMoo/FRBRoo.

definition.value: A description of a Datasets entry in the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: A description of a Datasets entry in the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Should be used to link departments and reserch labs to their holding organizations, such as universities.

comment.en: Indicates a unit which is part of this Organization, e.g. a Department within a larger Organization. Usage Note: should be used to link departments and reserch labs to their holding organizations, such as universities.

scopeNote.value: Can be used to attach relevant entities to a research project activity.

comment.en: This property describes the CRM Entities documented by instances of Digitization Processes. Usage Note: Can be used to attach relevant entities to a research project activity.

definition.value: This property contains the date on which the subject class was changed or modified. (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: This property contains the date on which the subject class was changed or modified. (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as by a coordinate, address, landmark, and so forth.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as crm:P7_took_place_at within the activity provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: A location can be an identifiable geographic place (ISO 19112), but it can also be a non-geographic place such as a directory, row, or column. As such, there are numerous ways in which location can be expressed, such as by a coordinate, address, landmark, and so forth. Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as crm:P7_took_place_at within the activity provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. scopeNote.value: This property refers to the format of the file in which the data is contained in a compressed form. Uses values from the EU File Type authority table (DCAT AP documentation).
Uses values from the http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/file-type authority table.
This property refers to the format of the file in which the data is contained in a compressed form (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Uses values from http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/frequency.

definition.value: This property associates an instance of D7 Digital Machine Event with an instance of D1 Digital Object which is the input used to specify the machine action.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as prov:used within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

scopeNote.value: This should generally reference the year (and month and/or date) that work on a research project ended.

comment.en: The time at which an activity ended. Usage Note: This should generally reference the year (and month and/or date) that work on a research project ended.

definition.value: This property refers to a page or document about the subject class. (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: For the dcat:Dataset class dcat:landingpage is preferred and foaf:page should be reserved when a page provides additional, meaningful information about the Dataset (such as how the Dataset was notated, sourced etc.). For the dcat:Distribution class a similar logic applies where dcat:accessURL is preferred and foaf:page should only be used if some meaningful information is available, especially as it relates to the distribution (for example how to access/use the contents of the downloaded file).

comment.en: This property refers to a page or document about the subject class. (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: For the dcat:Dataset class dcat:landingpage is preferred and foaf:page should be reserved when a page provides additional, meaningful information about the Dataset (such as how the Dataset was notated, sourced etc.). For the dcat:Distribution class a similar logic applies where dcat:accessURL is preferred and foaf:page should only be used if some meaningful information is available, especially as it relates to the distribution (for example how to access/use the contents of the downloaded file).

definition.value: This property links the Dataset to an available Distribution (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: A language of the item. scopeNote.value: Can be used for a more detailed description of how two entities produced or used by a research project are related through the concept of derivation.

comment.en: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity. definition.value: This property documents that an instance of E89 Propositional Object has as subject an instance of E1 CRM Entity.

scopeNote.value: This property should be used to connect instances of F3 Manifestation (subclass of E89) to their subject, and is intended to help connect research activity and outputs to the cultural heritage entities they use.

comment.en: This property documents that an instance of E89 Propositional Object has as subject an instance of E1 CRM Entity. Usage Note: should be used to connect instances of F3 Manifestation (subclass of E89) to their subject, and is intended to help connect research activity and outputs to the cultural heritage entities they use.

definition.value: The temporal period that the dataset covers (W3C DCAT documentation).

comment.en: The temporal period that the dataset covers (W3C DCAT documentation).

definition.value: A main category of the resource. A resource can have multiple themes (W3C DCAT documentation).

scopeNote.value: For Catalog class it uses values from https://github.com/italia/daf-ontologie-vocabolari-controllati/tree/master/VocabolariControllati/classifications-for-culture/subject-disciplines to note for the academic discipline(s) the research project falls under and values from a relevant authority for its primary subject (VIAF, Wikidata etc.), such as for example a historical figure; for the DataService class it uses values from the Tadirah research activity taxonomy and the PCDAI controlled vocabularies (if applicable); for the Dataset class it uses values from the https://op.europa.eu/s/yLXU authority table and the Tadirah taxonomy.

comment.en: A main category of the resource. A resource can have multiple themes (W3C DCAT documentation). Usage Note: For Catalog class use values from the Ambiti Disciplinari controlled vocabulary to note the academic discipline(s) the research project falls under and values from a relevant authority for the research project's primary subject (VIAF, Wikidata etc.), such as for example a historical figure; for the DataService class it uses values from the Tadirah research activity taxonomy and the PCDAI controlled vocabularies (if applicable); for the Dataset class it uses values from the EU Data Theme authority table and the Tadirah taxonomy.

definition.value: This property contains the main identifier for the Dataset, e.g. the URI or other unique identifier in the context of the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: This property contains the main identifier for the Dataset, e.g. the URI or other unique identifier in the context of the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: This property identifies a Data Object that came into existence as a result of a D11 Digital Measurement Event.

scopeNote.value: This property uses the superclass of D11 in the context of the PCDAI Data Model (based on CIDOC CRM's inheritance system) to describe the result of a digitization process.

comment.en: This property identifies a Data Object that came into existence as a result of a D11 Digital Measurement Event. Usage Note: This property uses the superclass of D11 in the context of the PCDAI Data Model (based on CIDOC CRM's inheritance system) to describe the result of a digitization process.

comment.en: This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.

definition.value: Influence is the capacity of an entity, activity, or agent to have an effect on the character, development, or behavior of another by means of usage, start, end, generation, invalidation, communication, derivation, attribution, association, or delegation.

scopeNote.value: Can be used for a more detailed description of how two entities and/or activities are related through the concept of influence, if derivation is not applicable. For example, academic research projects may be inspired by the works of an author or by activities of another research group which could be described as a form of influence

comment.en: Influence is the capacity of an entity, activity, or agent to have an effect on the character, development, or behavior of another by means of usage, start, end, generation, invalidation, communication, derivation, attribution, association, or delegation. Usage Note: Can be used for a more detailed description of how two entities and/or activities are related through the concept of influence, if derivation or informed is not applicable. For example, academic research projects may be inspired by the works of an author or by activities of another research group which could be described as a form of influence.

Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: This property describes the active participation of an instance of E39 Actor in an instance of E7 Activity. It implies causal or legal responsibility. comment.en: This property refers to the file format of the Distribution, most likely the format of the downloadable form of a dataset. Usage Note: Uses values from the EU File Type authority table where possible (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: This property links the Catalogue with a Dataset that is part of the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: A derivation is a transformation of an entity into another, an update of an entity resulting in a new one, or the construction of a new entity based on a pre-existing entity.

comment.en: Used to qualify prov:wasDerivedFrom.

definition.value: This property refers to a related Dataset of which the described Dataset is a version, edition, or adaptation (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Can be used similarly to dct:hasVersion in an inverse manner.

definition.value: An activity association is an assignment of responsibility to an agent for an activity, indicating that the agent had a role in the activity. It further allows for a plan to be specified, which is the plan intended by the agent to achieve some goals in the context of this activity.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as dct:creator/publisher and crm:P14_carried_out_by within the academic provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

It further allows for a plan to be specified, which is the plan intended by the agent to achieve some goals in the context of this activity. Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as dct:creator/publisher and crm:P14_carried_out_by within the academic provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. definition.value: This property refers to the licence under which the subject class is made available can be used or reused (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: In the case of multiple licenses applying to one research project - for example one license for the website and its content and another for a dataset (or distribution, or service) - refer to the class definitions to ascertain which license should be attached to which class. A practical example: a research project features three licenses, one for the text on its website (dcat:Catalog), one for a dataset distributed as a .csv (dcat:Dataset, dcat:Distribution), and one for a service on its website that allows manipulation of the dataset (dcat:DataService). Uses values from the https://schema.gov.it/lodview/controlled-vocabulary/licences controlled vocabulary (DCAT AP IT documentation).

comment.en: This property refers to the licence under which the subject class is made available and can be used or reused (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: In the case of multiple licenses applying to one research project - for example one license for the website and its content and another for a dataset (or distribution, or service) - refer to the class definitions to ascertain which license should be attached to which class. A practical example: a research project features three licenses, one for the text on its website (dcat:Catalog), one for a dataset distributed as a .csv (dcat:Dataset, dcat:Distribution), and one for a service on its website that allows manipulation of the dataset (dcat:DataService). Uses values from the Licenze controlled vocabulary (DCAT AP IT documentation).

definition.value: This property is about a related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to the dataset (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Should be used to connect a dataset to relevant academic publications. In the case that there are multiple publications a link to a page that collects details of all existing publication about a project is appropriate.

comment.en: This property is about a related resource, such as a publication, that references, cites, or otherwise points to the dataset (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: Should be used to connect a dataset to relevant academic publications. In the case that there are multiple publications a link to a page that collects details of all existing publication about a project is appropriate.

definition.value: This property associates an instance of D7 Digital Machine Event with an instance of D1 Digital Object which is the output of the activity.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as prov:generated within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: This property associates an instance of D7 Digital Machine Event with an instance of D1 Digital Object which is the output of the activity. Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as prov:generated within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

definition.value: The resource described in the record. Each catalog record can have at most one primary topic i.e. describes one dataset or service (W3C DCAT documentation).

comment.en: The resource described in the record. Each catalog record can have at most one primary topic i.e. describes one dataset or service (W3C DCAT documentation).

definition.value: This property associates an instance of D7 Digital Machine Event with the instance of D14 Software that it used.

scopeNote.value: Can be used to describe the IT infrastructure of a research project activity in combination with values from the PCDAI Technology Thesaurus.

comment.en: This property associates an instance of D7 Digital Machine Event with the instance of D14 Software that it used. Usage Note: Can be used to describe the IT infrastructure of a research project activity in combination with values from the PCDAI Technology Thesaurus.

definition.value: This property refers to a data service that gives access to the distribution of the dataset.

comment.en: This property refers to a data service that gives access to the distribution of the dataset.

definition.value: This property refers to information that indicates whether the Dataset is open data, has access restrictions or is not public (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Use one of the following values (:public, :restricted, :non-public) from http://publications.europa.eu/resource/authority/access-right.

comment.en: This property refers to information that indicates whether the Dataset is open data, has access restrictions or is not public. Usage Note: Use one of the following values (:public, :restricted, :non-public) from the EU Access Right authority table (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: This property refers to a secondary identifier of the Dataset, such as MAST/ADS , DataCite , DOI , EZID  or W3ID (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: This property should be used for external identifiers.

comment.en: This property refers to a secondary identifier of the Dataset, such as MAST/ADS , DataCite , DOI , EZID  or W3ID (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: This property should be used for external identifiers.

definition.value: This property refers to a web page that provides access to the Dataset, its Distributions and/or additional information. It is intended to point to a landing page at the original data provider, not to a page on a site of a third party, such as an aggregator (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: This property should be prioritised over foaf:page with the latter only used if the page it points to provides meaningful additional information not included in the page used for dcat:landingPage (such as how the Dataset was notated, sourced etc.).

comment.en: This property refers to a web page that provides access to the Dataset, its Distributions and/or additional information. It is intended to point to a landing page at the original data provider, not to a page on a site of a third party, such as an aggregator (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: This property should be prioritised over foaf:page with the latter only used if the page it points to provides meaningful additional information not included in the page used for dcat:landingPage (such as how the Dataset was notated, sourced etc.).

definition.value: This property refers to a related Dataset that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the described Dataset (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Can be used to indicate versioning of a dataset / research output within the same research project or to refer to datasets / research outputs created by other research projects that adapt it. For any other relations between datasets / outputs use dct:relation.

comment.en: This property refers to a related Dataset that is a version, edition, or adaptation of the described Dataset (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: Can be used to indicate versioning of a dataset / research output within the same research project or to refer to datasets / research outputs created by other research projects that adapt it. For any other relations between datasets / outputs use dct:relation.

definition.value: This property refers to a web page that acts as the main page for the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: This property refers to a web page that acts as the main page for the Catalogue (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: The time at which an activity started.

scopeNote.value: This should generally reference the year (and month and/or date) that work on a research project began.

comment.en: The time at which an activity started. Usage Note: This should generally reference the year (and month and/or date) that work on a research project began.

definition.value: Usage is the beginning of utilizing an entity by an activity. Before usage, the activity had not begun to utilize this entity and could not have been affected by the entity.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as crmdig:L10_had_input within the academic provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: Usage is the beginning of utilizing an entity by an activity. Before usage, the activity had not begun to utilize this entity and could not have been affected by the entity. Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as crmdig:L10_had_input within the academic provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

definition.value: This property refers to a geographic region that is covered by the Dataset (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Uses values from Geonames and Wikidata.

comment.en: This property refers to a geographic region that is covered by the Dataset (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: Uses values from Geonames and Wikidata.

definition.value: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI) (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: In the context of the PCDAI Data Model, primary endpoints may often refer to specific pages within a website where data processing services can accessed and used via a dedicate web interface, as opposed to a more traditional API endpoint for example.

comment.en: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI) (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: In the context of the PCDAI Data Model, primary endpoints may often refer to specific pages within a website where data processing services can accessed and used via a dedicate web interface, as opposed to a more traditional API endpoint for example.

definition.value: This property refers to an Application Profile, implementing rule or other specification, or established schema that the subject class conforms to (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: This property refers to an Application Profile, implementing rule or other specification, or established schema that the subject class conforms to (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: Communication is the exchange of an entity by two activities, one activity using the entity generated by the other.

scopeNote.value: Can be used for a more detailed description of how two activities are related through the concept of information. The range of this property has been extended to include instances of D7 from the CRM DIG model to enable the description of relationships between the research project as an overall activity (prov:Activity) and specific activities (or tasks) that happen within it, such as for example the digitization of physical objects, and which are described using the CRM DIG model.

comment.en: Communication is the exchange of an entity by two activities, one activity using the entity generated by the other. Usage Note: Can be used for a more detailed description of how two activities are related through the concept of information. Usage Note: The range of this property has been extended to include instances of D7 from the CRM DIG model to enable the description of relationships between the research project as an overall activity (prov:Activity) and specific activities (or tasks) that happen within it, such as for example the digitization of physical objects, and which are described using the CRM DIG model.

definition.value: This property describes the use of material or immaterial things in a way essential to the performance or the outcome of an instance of E7 Activity. This property typically applies to tools, instruments, moulds, raw materials and items embedded in a product. It implies that the presence of the object in question was a necessary condition for the action. For example, the activity of writing this text required the use of a computer. An immaterial thing can be used if at least one of its carriers is present. For example, the software tools on a computer.

scopeNote.value: This property is included as the super property of L10 had input.

comment.en: This property describes the use of material or immaterial things in a way essential to the performance or the outcome of an instance of E7 Activity. It is included as the super property of L10 had input.

scopeNote.value: Use of a more specific sub-property is recommended (dcat:dataset, dcat:service) when available.

comment.en: This is the most general predicate for membership of a catalog. Use of a more specific sub-property is recommended (dcat:dataset, dcat:service) when available (W3C DCAT documentation).

definition.value: Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as crmdig:L11_had_output within the academic provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: Generation is the completion of production of a new entity by an activity. This entity did not exist before generation and becomes available for usage after this generation. Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as crmdig:L11_had_output within the academic provenance segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

definition.value: An object property to express the accountability of an agent towards another agent. The subordinate agent acted on behalf of the responsible agent in an actual activity.

scopeNote.value: Can be used to provide further details on relationships between agents within a research project, such as for example departments or laboratories acting on behalf of a university.

comment.en: An object property to express the accountability of an agent towards another agent. The subordinate agent acted on behalf of the responsible agent in an actual activity.

definition.value: This property refers to an activity that generated, or provides the business context for, the creation of the dataset (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: This property is used to connect the public data segment of the PCDAI Data Model to the provenance segment, where the activities that generated the data can be further detailed.

comment.en: This property refers to an activity that generated, or provides the business context for, the creation of the dataset (DCAT AP documentation, see prov:generated for PROV-O definition). Usage Note: This property is used to connect the public data segment of the PCDAI Data Model to the provenance segment, where the activities that generated the data can be further detailed.

definition.value: References an prov:Entity which influenced a resource.

comment.en: References an prov:Entity which influenced a resource.

definition.value: This property contains a URL that gives access to a Distribution of the Dataset. The resource at the access URL may contain information about how to get the Dataset.

scopeNote.value: For direct downloads use dcat:downloadURL.

comment.en: This property contains a URL that gives access to a Distribution of the Dataset. The resource at the access URL may contain information about how to get the Dataset. Usage Note: For direct downloads use dcat:downloadURL.

definition.value: A keyword or tag describing the resource (W3C DCAT documentation).

scopeNote.value: This property should be used after dcat:theme and dct:type to attach anything that isn't covered by those properties and is relevant to the description of the resource.

comment.en: A keyword or tag describing the resource (W3C DCAT documentation). Usage Note: This property should be used after dcat:theme and dct:type to attach anything that isn't covered by those properties and is relevant to the description of the resource.

definition.value: This property contains a URL that is a direct link to a downloadable file in a given format (DCAT AP documentation).

comment.en: This property contains a URL that is a direct link to a downloadable file in a given format (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: The status of the distribution in the context of maturity lifecycle. It MUST take one of the values Completed, Deprecated, Under Development, Withdrawn from the ADMS vocabulary (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: Uses values from http://purl.org/adms/status/1.0

comment.en: The status of the distribution in the context of maturity lifecycle. It MUST take one of the values Completed, Deprecated, Under Development, Withdrawn from the ADMS vocabulary (DCAT AP documentation).

definition.value: This property associates an instance of D10 Software Execution with an instance of D1 Digital Object which is used as a source, software essential for the performance.

scopeNote.value: This property should be used to describe software driven processes or activities within a research project.

comment.en: This property associates an instance of D10 Software Execution with an instance of D1 Digital Object which is used as a source, software essential for the performance. Usage Note: This property should be used to describe software driven processes or activities within a research project.

definition.value: This property describes the spatial location of an instance of E4 Period. The related instance of E53 Place should be seen as a wider approximation of the geometric area within which the phenomena that characterise the period in question occurred.

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as prov:atLocation within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: This property describes the spatial location of an instance of E4 Period. The related instance of E53 Place should be seen as a wider approximation of the geometric area within which the phenomena that characterise the period in question occurred. Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as prov:atLocation within the cultural heritage segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

definition.value: This property associates an instance of F3 Manifestation with an instance of F5 Item that is one of its exemplars or its only exemplar.

scopeNote.value: Usage and definition of this property are based on the LRMoo v0.9 specifications.

comment.en: This property associates an instance of F3 Manifestation with an instance of F5 Item that is one of its exemplars or its only exemplar. Usage Note: Usage and definition of this property are based on the LRMoo v0.9 specifications.

definition.value: Influence is the capacity of an entity, activity, or agent to have an effect on the character, development, or behavior of another by means of usage, start, end, generation, invalidation, communication, derivation, attribution, association, or delegation.

comment.en: Used to qualify prov:wasInfluencedBy.

definition.value: This property refers to entities responsible for the creation of the subject class (DCAT AP documentation).

scopeNote.value: This property enables similar descriptions as crm:P14_carried_out_by and prov:wasAssociatedWith within the public data segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

comment.en: This property refers to entities responsible for the creation of the subject class (DCAT AP documentation). Usage Note: This property enables similar descriptions as crm:P14_carried_out_by and prov:wasAssociatedWith within the public data segment of the PCDAI Data Model. Please see the Data Model documentation for full details of how PCDAI makes use of classes and properties that relate to similar concepts but refer to specific conceptual definitions.

scopeNote.value: The nature or genre of the Dataset or Data Service (W3C DCAT documentation).
Uses values from the PCDAI controlled vocabularies.

comment.en: The nature or genre of the Dataset or Data Service (W3C DCAT documentation). Usage Note: Uses values from the PCDAI controlled vocabularies.
